channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports

  • City: LA SALLE

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While in transit, a pallet of (UN3265) NALCO DC14 shifted resulting in the caps of (3) Jerricans hitting the pallet/trailer floor and releasing approximately 5-gallons of product. A contractor neutralized the spilled product with Sodium Bicarbonate prior to cleaning up the release. Once the lids were tightened on the (3) Jerricans, they were able to ship on to the intended destination. No storm drains. waterways, or soil were impacted.

  • City: CHICAGO

  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 2, 2023, two (2) one-gallon cans of UN1263 were punctured by a forklift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews downstacked and repalletized the non-impacted pails of product onto a new pallet. The damaged pails and all impacted debris were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums for transport and disposal.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 2, 2023, two (2) 5-gallon pails of UN1993 were crushed in transit and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Indiana Spill Response (ISR) to remediate the impacted site. ISR personnel collected two (2) damaged 5-gallon pails for disposal. Crews then deployed granular absorbent to the impacted trailer floor, concrete and nearby trench drain and worked them in utilizing hand tools. All UN1993 impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

  • Description: On November 1, 2023, two (2) 50-pound bags of UN3378 were punctured by a forklift and released approximately less than one (<1) pound of product to the concrete dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from OMI/E3 to remediate the impacted site. OMI/E3 deconstructed the pallet and removed two (2) 50 pound bags from the pallet. The crew collected the released material with and tools. OMI/E3 placed the released material and two (2) damaged bags into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report I-2023110026
item.description:
Report I-2023110026

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-11
  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNIVAR SOLUTIONS USA INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Univar Solutions Driver went to load a tanker at Associated Asphalt with Caustic Soda 50% at 8:30AM on October 11th. Driver failed to recognize seal on external valve of tanker indicating tanker was filled, and failed to check dome gasket because of visibility. Driver arrived at Associated Asphalt, inputted his load number with specific weights, and popped the dome gasket. Loading then began and once the control arm hit 21,0001bs the tanker began to overfill. Driver hit the stopfill button once he noticed that product was coming over the top, but 25-30 gallons of product was released onto the asphalt. Associated Asphalt workers and driver cleaned up spill with spill pads and sorb-oil. NRC clean up company has been contracted to take care of any leftover product on asphalt ground to prevent any residues flowing to retention pond. No injuries.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 31, 2023, seven (7) one-gallon pails of UN1263 were crushed in transit and released approximately six (6) ounces of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ancon Services (AS) to remediate the impacted site. AS personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and soda ash to remediate the UN1263 impacted impacted dock floor. AS personnel solidified and neutralized the damaged pails of product. The damaged pails and all impacted debris were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums to be staged onsite for transport and disposal.

R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and utilized hand tools to collect the product in two (2) 55-gallon drums. The one (1) damaged pail was overpacked in one (1) of the previously mentioned waste drums.

  • Description: On October 27, 2023, two (2) 1-gallon cans of UN1967 fell in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EX Environmental (EX) to remediate the impacted site. EX personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted trailer floor, swept them in, and collected them with hand tools. Crews also wiped down the impacted trailer floor. The two (2) damaged cans, all spent absorbents, impacted cardboard, and any cleanup debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023100949
item.description:
Report E-2023100949

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-01
  • City: CUMBERLAND
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX Transportation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 10/01/2023, at 0431 hours, personnel in the CSXT Cumberland Yard discovered SHQX 51000, a residue tank car of Liquefied Petroleum Gases, leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, National Response Center, and Maryland Department of the Environment were notified. Specialized Professional Services, Inc., a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the B-End liquid valve and vapor valve partially open and the secondary closure plugs improperly installed resulting in an active release of lading. The issues were identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper, Mr. Derek Campbell of Kiros Energy, phone 403.483.1250. Contractor personnel closed both open valves and properly installed the secondary closure plugs in accordance with 49 CFR 173.31. The leak was secured and the car was released for transport. This incident did not require a special switching move. 7.1 is not required. Cause Code: 119 NARRI: 90

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found leaking while being sorted for delivery during Inbound. The package was found leaking, and QA was called. DescribePack: The package contents were spilling from the cap and were dented during sort. there was no bracing or filament in the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA brought absorbent and a tote to clean up what ever leakage was at location. Everything was handled with gloves and brought to hazmats to be processed and inspected.

item.title: Report X-2023101354
item.description:
Report X-2023101354

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-17
  • City: BARRINGTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023101354 SequenceEvent: DURING THE UNLOAD PROCESS THE MANAGER NOTICED THAT THE BOTTOM OF THE BOX WAS WET AND TORN A LITTLE BIT. MANAGER IMMEDIATELY TOOK THE PACKAGE OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT PROPERLY. I WAS THEN CALLED OVER TO SAFELY REPACK IT INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM. DescribePack: THERE WAS 4 BOTTLES OF RAPICDE. TWO OF PART B AND TWO OF PART A. THERE WAS A LOOSE CAP ON ONE OF THE BOTTLES OF PART B AND DUE TO IT HAVING A LOOSE CAP APPROXIAMTELY 0.5 (1/2) OF A CUP ENDED UP LEAKING OUT CAUSING THE BOX ITSELF TO GET TORN AND WET AS WELL. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: MANAGER IMMEDIATELY TAKING PACKAGE OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE AND THEN CALLING ME OVER TO REPACK IT INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM IN SAFE AND TIMELY MANNER. 2. X-2023101358 SequenceEvent: DURING THE UNLOAD THE MANAGER NOTICED THAT THE BOX WAS WET AND TORN ON THE BOTTOM SIDE OF THE PACKAGE. THE MANAGER IMMEDIATELY TOOK THE PACKAGE OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT PROPERLY. I WAS THEN CALLED OVER SO I COULD SAFELY REPACK IT INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM. DescribePack: THERE WERE 4 BOTTLES ON THE INSIDE OF THE PACKAGE. TWO OF THEM WERE RAPICIDE PART A AND THE OTHER TWO WERE RAPICIDE PART B. ONE OF THAT BOTTLES OF THE PART B SOLUTION HAD A LOOSE CAP WHICH THEN CAUSED IT TO LEAK OUT ONTO THE OTHER BOTTLES AND ONTO THE BOX ITSELD. APPROXIAMTELY 1 CUP LEAKED OUT DUE TO THE LOOSE CAP. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE MANAGER IMMEDIATELY TAKING THE PACKAGE OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT AND THEN CALLING ME OVER TO REPACK IT INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM SAFELY AND IN A TIMELY FASHION.

  • Description: The tank car was seen by UPRR yard personnel to be leaking as it was being moved in the Reisor Yard in Shreveport LA. Haz Mat Manager Tom Robinson was called for a response. Mgr. Robinson called an emergency response contractor, and they got on site before he did. The car was leaking from a misaligned man way gasket and needed to be replaced. The gasket was replaced, and the man way was properly secured and the top and sides of the car wiped down so it could continue in transportation.

item.description:
Report X-2023101139

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-20
  • City: IRVING
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 10/20/23 at aproximately 1230, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 563935 to the station location in Irving, reporting an undeclared hazardous substance shipment. The shipment consists for eight fiberboard boxes, each containing one plastic jerrican labeled "Champignon Liquid" from China. The shipment emitted an odor, warranting further investigation. An online sds of a similar product revealed that the commodity is classifed as UN 3082. The shipment was not prepared in accordanace with IATA Regulations, having shipped without the requires markings, labeling, packaging and paperwork. The complete shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

  • City: ELLENWOOD

  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 27, 2023, two (2) 5-gallon bags of UN3266 were punctured by a forklift and released approximately seven (7) gallons of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site, HES personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the sodium hydroxide-impacted impacted loading dock floor. The crew de palletized, re palletized, and shrink wrapped the freight for the customer. The damaged bags and all impacted debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

  • City: ROCHESTER
  • State: NY

  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 27, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN2922 was damaged in transit due to improper bracing and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer floor, cardboard box, and surrounding cargo. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Republic Services (RS) to remediate the impacted site. Granular absorbents were deployed to the impacted trailer floor and worked in with hand tools. Crews utilized absorbent pads to remove any residual product. The impacted cardboard and all UN2922 impacted materials were collected and containerized into one (1) 30-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 26, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN2920 leaked during transit and released approximately one (1) cup of product to the top of the drum. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. EWI personnel transferred the UN2920 corrosive liquid from the damaged drum into one (1) new 55-gallon poly drum to be shipped to its next destination. The damaged poly drum was cut up with hand tools and placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum, along with the general cleanup debris.

item.title: Report X-2023101299
item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-17T18:14:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-16
  • City: HOLBROOK
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The hazmat was transported to the van line on a cart. When the package handler lifted the box, it slipped out of his grip and fell to the floor. The inner glass cracked, then broke and leaked the acetone out of the bottle. The package handler immediately notified QA who got absorbent materials and mopped up the spilled acetone using rubber gloves and a plastic container for disposal. The box was placed inside a plastic hazmat red container and brought to the hazmat cage for the HESS report to be completed. DescribePack: The hazmat had one of the glass liter containers break. The container had molded reconstituted paper as liners to keep the glass containers safe. However, there was 3 inches of empty space on the top of the container. This left movement for the glass containers to move around inside the fiberboard box. If the box had 1 1/2" foam on the top of the box and 1 1/2 " foam on the bottom of the box, the bottles would have been secure and safer. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: When the inner glass cracked, then broke and leaked the acetone out of the bottle, the package handler immediately notified QA who got absorbent materials and mopped up the spilled acetone using rubber gloves and a plastic container for disposal. The box was placed inside a plastic hazmat red container and brought to the hazmat cage for the HESS report to be completed.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 10/7/2023 at approximately 0330, Dangerous Goods Administration recieved a call from Employee 292350 at the hub facilty in Memphis, reporting an aerosol spill. The shipment consisted of 3 overpacked pallets with multiple dangerous goods shipments that originated in the United Kingdom. The pallets did not clear customs and were set to be returned to the origin location. One of the pallet, ending in -9260 was held due to one of the pacakges falling from under the wrapping. The fallen package sustained damage, due to human error, and is unable to complete transport. The remainder of the pallet is being held, pending the receipt of an amended shipper's declaration for further transport.

  • Description: Aircraft was being boarded when passenger sitting in seat 16C noticed smoke coming from their fanny pack. They stood up but could not exit the aircraft because passengers were still boarding and isle way was congested. Passenger passed the fanny pack to other passengers until the fanny pack was thrown in the jetway and doused with water by a deadhead flight attendant. When smoking had ceased and device was cooled down, it was removed. Flight continued to board and departed. Photos upon request.

item.description:
Report I-2023100036

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-16T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-11
  • City: Cincinnati
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SES-R1 LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Pallet of 4 x 55 gallon steel drums were being removed from a van trailer. When the forklift operator went to back out of the trailer, the pallet failed due to the weight of the drums. When the pallet broke, 1 of the drums tipped against the wall of the trailer and liquid started leaking out of from the ring of the lid. Roughly 2.5 gallons leaked out into the trailer for a period of about 30 seconds. The warehouse associate was able to upright the drum and the leak stopped. Forklift operator and warehouse associate placed spill pads on the floor and soaked up the free liquids, and wiped down the back of the trailer. Upon further inspection of the drum, the lid was removed and revealed that it did not contain a gasket.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE UNLOAD PROCESS THE MANAGER NOTICED THAT THE PACKAGE WAS UPSIDE DOWN AND THAT IT WAS ALSO WET. MANAGER IMMEDICATELY TOOK PACKAGE OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO PROPERLY SECURE AND VENTILATE PACKAGE. I WAS THEN CALLED OVER TO START THE REPACK PROCESS. DescribePack: THE BOX ITSELF WAS UPSIDE DOWN, ARROWS FACING THE WRONG DIRECTION AND EVERYTHING. TWO OF THE FOUR BOTTLES ON THE INSIDE WERE ALSO FACING THE WRONG DIRECTION. ONE OF THE FOUR BOTTLES HAD A LOOSE CAP CAUSING IT TO LEAK. APPROXIAMTELY 2 CUPS OF DISINFECTANT LEAKED OUT ONTO CAUSING THE BOX TO BE ALL WET AND START RIPPING APART. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: MANAGER TAKING PACKAGE IMMEDICATELY OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT AND THEN CALLING ME OVER. I THEN REPACKED THE PACKAGE INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM SAFELY AND IN A TIMELY MANNER.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The delivery driver coded package "06" Customer Refused/Damaged. Delivery driver brought package back to warehouse. Package was placed in yellow hazmat drum by PM personnel and left in QA processing area for AM personnel. The next morning package was inspected by morning shift personnel. Yellow drum was opened. Package was taken out, processed, placed in Blue Hazmat bag and placed back inside drum. DescribePack: Upon inspection discovered outer packing was wet and ripped. Discovered one gallon of coil cleaner had loose cap. 1 quart of Coil cleaner liquid leaked out into box and on all contents. The other 3 gallons of cleaner were dented. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside yellow hazmat drum and sealed by pm shift personnel to await processing the next morning.

item.title: Report X-2023100981
item.description:
Report X-2023100981

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-16T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-10
  • City: BARRINGTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023100981 SequenceEvent: Package was found in a truck that came back from deliveries. It was then put in a red tote and hazmat bag and placed in the hazmat cage for processing. This happened on 10/10/2023 about 14:oo. DescribePack: The package was wet and deteriorating. One of the 5-liter bottles that was in the box had a loose cap. It leaked in and out of the box, wetting a couple of other hazmat boxes. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat was placed in a red Hazmat tote and Hazmat bag. It was then taken to the Hazmat cage, where it was processed. 2. X-2023101000 SequenceEvent: DURING THE UNLOAD PROCESS THE MANAGER NOTICED THAT THE PACKAGE WAS UPSIDE DOWN AND THAT IT WAS ALSO WET. MANAGER IMMEDICATELY TOOK PACKAGE OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO PROPERLY SECURE AND VENTILATE PACKAGE. I WAS THEN CALLED OVER TO START THE REPACK PROCESS. DescribePack: THE BOX ITSELF WAS UPSIDE DOWN, ARROWS FACING THE WRONG DIRECTION AND EVERYTHING. TWO OF THE FOUR BOTTLES ON THE INSIDE WERE ALSO FACING THE WRONG DIRECTION. ONE OF THE FOUR BOTTLES HAD A LOOSE CAP CAUSING IT TO LEAK. APPROXIAMTELY 2 CUPS OF DISINFECTANT LEAKED OUT ONTO CAUSING THE BOX TO BE ALL WET AND START RIPPING APART. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: MANAGER TAKING PACKAGE IMMEDICATELY OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT AND THEN CALLING ME OVER. I THEN REPACKED THE PACKAGE INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM SAFELY AND IN A TIMELY MANNER.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was unloaded from the trailer and loaded onto a tugger cart. The package was then taken to the van lines and loaded underneath the belt. When the driver was loading his van he noticed the box was slightly wet on the corner and called for a manager. QA came and placed the box into a tote lined with a bag. The package was then taken to the QA cage damage area where the package was inspected. DescribePack: the caps on the top of each bottle was loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The caps were tightened and the package was placed into a tote lined with a bag.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat in leaking fiberboard box found on APA chute (intercept/discharge from mezzanine) and brought to HMPA staging pallet. Unclear whether package came down damaged and whether it was in tote upon discharge from mezzanine. Spidr images from the overhead scan tunnels taken prior to discovery do not reflect damage in sortation. DescribePack: One of the two 2.5 gallon plastic bottles lost 0.2 gallons of fluid from a 1.2" crack on the bottom of the handle body (not following seam). Improper handling; overhead scans on mezzanine. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned. Package found with spillage in lined and lidded red tote.

item.title: Report X-2023100942
item.description:
Report X-2023100942

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-16T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-09
  • City: EDINBURG
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was inbound scanned at 0433. At approximately 0510 QA was called to unload managers desk by baydoor 12. QA was notified that HazMat package appeared to be leaking and that their was a strong smell emanating from package. Upon inspection it was found that one of the two items in the package had a loose top that allowed some of its inner contents to spill out. HazMat was placed in a salvage drum and moved to QA1 to process post sort. DescribePack: 2 items were found in the package. 1 was a gallon of paint and the other was a gallon of paint thinner. The lid on the can of paint thinner was loose and allowed some of its contents to spill out. Lower right corner of outer packaging appears to have a regangle shaped wet mark of about 3 x 5 inches. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: As soon as QA identified that the package was indeed a damaged HazMat the item was placed in a salvage drum, picked up from the unload and brought to QA1 to be processed post sort.

Report X-2023100941

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-07
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pile of Ecolab hazmat packages found 5:30pm on Trailer 954036 from 755 MESQ on Door 82 of the small unload. Plastic 5 gallon drum of Ecolab Built Detergent was found upside down and when placed upright it was discovered lid seal was leaking. The package was placed in a lined red tote and removed from operations posthaste. DescribePack: Lid seal consistently leaking on all sides of the packaging. The drum was found upside down, suggesting internal corrosion of the inner seal. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned. Package and spillage were placed in a lined and lidded red tote for transport to the HMPA. Care was taken to separate this hazmat from another leaking hazmat of Sodium hypochlorite solution within the same trailer.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 10/8/2023 at approximatley 2000, Dangerous Goods Adminstration received a call from Employee 5433639 at the ramp facility in Seattle, reporting a undeclared corrosive shipment. The shipment consistes 16 bottles of Carpet stair remover. The shipment discovered leaking during loading. A safety data sheet found online revealed that the contents is classified as UN3265. The shipment was not prepared in accordance with IATA regulatoions, as it was without markings, labeling, packaging and paperwork. The shipment is being held, pending an investigation from the FAA.

  • Description: Diesel fuel was observed leaking from the manway on the VMSX 310119 while at the Balmer railyard on 9/8/23. The car was isolated for inspection. Hazmat responders identified the release as coming from the manway sealing area underneath the cover. Upon inspection it was found that the manway gasket had not been applied resulting in a small release of diesel fuel to the car body. Crews added a gasket and secured the car. Release loss estimates are based upon visual observations of the responders.

item.title: Report X-2023100749
item.description:
Report X-2023100749

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-16T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-28
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: ILLINOIS CENTRAL RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: An FRA inspector observed liquid on the side of tank car # GATX 80428 appearing to be leaking from the manway cover (approximately 1/2 way down the side of the car) while performing a regulatory compliance check at the CN Glenn Yard in Chicago, IL. The inspector notified the CN Dangerous Goods Officer who responded to the incident location. The CN Dangerous Goods Officer's inspection of tank car revealed liquid leaking from the gasket sealing surface between the manway nozzle and the manway cover plate indicating a possible gasket failure. The liquid on the side of the tank car previously noted by the FRA inspector was nearing the bottom side of the tank car when the CN DGO arrived. The nitrogen pad pressure was relieved from the tank car. The manway cover was then opened for gasket inspection purposes. The (6) manway cover swing bolt nuts required a 36" pipe wrench and lubricating oil on the bolt threads to be loosened indicating the cover has not been opened for an extended period of time. The 20" manway cover lid gasket was removed and inspected. The inspection revealed the gasket to be delaminated in several areas and showed signs of deterioration throughout. The lid gasket was replaced with a 20" Teflon rim nozzle gasket and re-secured by the CN DGO. A response contractor decontaminated the tank car exterior and re-applied a nitrogen pad to the interior. The shipper listed on the waybill was notified of the incident through a Chemtrec report. The car will be released for continued transportation pending an OTMA 3 for an un-related defect.

item.title: Report I-2023080050
item.description:
Report I-2023080050

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-22T00:34:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-20
  • City: CONVERSE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: US ECOLOGY TRANSPORTATION SOLUTIONS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 21, 2023 at approximately 1030am a cargo tank trailer returning a rejected shipment of mixed acids from Gleco Plating started to leak on the shoulder of Loop 1604 in Converse Tx. Emergency responders were notified immediately, and US Ecology Emergency Response crews were dispatched from the US Ecology Cibolo Tx location less than 15 minutes away. The TCEQ and NRC were notified of the spill immediately after emergency response reaction. All lanes of Loop 1604 were closed between FM 78 and Lower Seguin Rd, they were re-opened around midnight once the highway was cleaned up. The Emergency Response crew unloaded waste from the tanker into totes until the tanker stopped leaking at which point it was transferred to the US Ecology Cibolo location to be stored within a bermed area for further unloading. All waste is being disposed of properly at an authorized facility and TX DOT has approved of the remediation at the spill site.

item.title: Report I-2023060175
item.description:
Report I-2023060175

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-18T00:32:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-04
  • City: WESTFIELD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CORRIGAN OIL CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Fuel transport vehicle E/B SR 32 (Main st) approaching the traffic circle at Poplar st. Transport was loaded with 8500 gallons of 87 octane gasoline. Electronic Log showed driver slowed to 19 mph as he was approaching circle. I was advised that a witness had seen the trailer strike the curb on the passenger side as it entered the circle. Driver then starts to accelerate as he was going through the circle to 22 mph. Driver stated that as he went around the circle the tractor and trailer started to roll. Driver stated that tractor went far enough over that he saw the asphalt roadway out the passenger side window. Driver stated that trailer king pin suddenly broke away from trailer and tractor suddenly slammed back down on its wheels. The driver was wearing his seatbelt. The trailer went down on it's passenger side, rolled, and landed back on it's driver side. Compartment #4 had a tear in the outer shell and was leaking from that damage. Product was also coming out of the interstitial holes located on the top of the trailer. Westfield Fire arrived on scene, set up initial containment, and plugged the leaks. Our environmental contractor (3 Pro environmental services) was on scene at 15:56 hrs and also assisted with containment, scene clean up, and remediation. 729 gallons of gasoline was spilled. 3 catch basins in area were affected but we're full of debris so they didn't drain away from scene. All catch basins sucked out and cleaned. 3 PRO Environmental contractor has been working with Indiana Dept. of Environmental Management Dwayne Caldwell (Incident #107392) since arrival on scene on date of incident. Also coordinating with Hamilton County Emergency Management and Westfield Stormwater and associated public services.
